website_summaries.verdict: A portable-size WD external hard drive with a small amount of storage perfect for travel.
pros: Quick USB 3.0 connect offers fast data transfer speeds
Small footprint and size for easy transportation
Compatible with Western Digital's online backup software
cons: 500GB space capacity is limited compared to other, newer options in the terabyte range

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: When I had received this product, I was so happy to finally be able to plug it into my computer, and store all of my files. Only to find that the device couldn't be detected. I tried troubleshooting this for a couple of days. I even was on-call with a representative of Western Digital to figure out the problem, but even they couldn't help me. I will try to order one, one more time, to see if it was a one time defect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Reliability in Home DVR Set-up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive as an accessory to my cord-cutting endeavor with my Tablo DVR. I do not actively use this hard drive on a daily basis, but it rather gets used behind the scenes by my Tablo devices multiple times per day. And I can happily say that I've had zero issues with it. It was formatted correctly, and has worked as advertised. Actual storage space after formatting was 492 GB, which is to be expected. If you are looking for a drive to use daily, I recommend the WD Elements drive - it is extremely reliable and has caused zero issues for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ghepetto41

customer_reviews.title: I have a 10 year old WD portable drive which is slightly bigger and that still works beautifully. This drive is a poor excuse for
customer_reviews.text: I used this expensive paper weight three times. It was never thrown in a bag. It never left the house. Was stored in a protective case. There is not reason for it to fail. I have a 10 year old WD portable drive which is slightly bigger and that still works beautifully. This drive is a poor excuse for WD
customer_reviews.author: Margaret D

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, compact, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if there's a higher compliment of this hard drive than to share that my technophobic wife stole it from me and uses it all of the time. Data transfers super fast, it is very easy to plug and play on multiple systems (we go between our PCs and Surface without incident), and it's very small and portable... which is why she took it. It's easy to transfer huge stores of data back and forth to work. I love this... and will probably buy it again. For myself.
customer_reviews.author: Pete O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is very compact and extremely easy to use. It's about 3 by 4 inches, and about 3/4 inches thick. This is a great way to protect your data. We all know how computers can unexpectedly die, so this is good "insurance" that your photos and documents won't be lost. You just plug it into the USB port on your computer and you can start downloading. You do not need an additional electrical outlet (which was what was necessary for my old clunker backup hard drive that was also much larger but had less storage than this one). I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: G Moxie

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Excellent with USB 3.0!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive because I wanted one that didn't empty my wallet, had a good amount of storage, and is from a vendor I know and love. The external hd itself is slim and about the dimensions of a wallet. Thus, it is very portable as the name suggests. Hooking it up is easy as pie. Take it out of the box and hook it up to your pc using the included cord. Also, if you want really fast transfer speed, plug it into your USB 3.0 connection. Currently pushing over 1GB transfer rate and it's sweet! For the price, you really can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Drive died after 20 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive in December 2013. Used it for my Xbox 360 which I didn't even use all that much. Today I turned it on and it had died. Won't show up in Windows, can't be reformatted by my Xbox. All my games are gone, and game saves, etc. Only lasted 1.5 years, which is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Reasonable Solution for Regular BackUps
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonable solution for backing up data. I bought my first one two years ago and have been so pleased with it that I bought this one for my daughter who has her own accounting business. Back up regularly... you never know when your hard drive will fail nor will you have advance notice that your computer will soon become a doorstop. Money well spent if you have electronic data that is irreplaceable. Amazon's products always seem to arrive days before the scheduled date, which is quite comforting.
customer_reviews.author: MikeH2SWL in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient and very help for my business and jobs, i can storage everything in there now, very organized and fast. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lang

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected as to cable connection. But hope I don't lose the special cable.
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised the cable connection was not a Micro USB but a combo one so it needs that cable only to transfer data. I have other Brands and none use this type of Cable just the Micro USB Type if I lose this cable the drive would need a new one and did not know about this till it arrived. So just buyer beware...I would have thought they would be the same as other exterior HD's but it was different but I am not much with computer tech stuff but bought other exterior drives and this is a first for me. Just needed to dll and save some pics and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Compact, quiet - nice as an image backup
customer_reviews.text: This now lives as my desktop's image backup. So, basically, it lives in my file cabinet. ;-) I have 1T's backing up on save on lap and desk. These are all compact, quiet 2.5" drives that will need to be reformatted if you want to run them OTG on, say, an S5. The software is pretty straightforward ... I deleted the trial stuff on this one, and use the included stuff on the other ones. Pretty foolproof ... as always - so far.
customer_reviews.author: MeteorMagnet

customer_reviews.title: Dependable HDD for backups
customer_reviews.text: Since I use this with an iMac computer the first thing I did is reformat it. OSX Disk Utility made this a breeze to do. The drive works well as a backup drive.
customer_reviews.author: jaxman

customer_reviews.title: Totally worthless
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. After 2 years of infrequent use I started having issues of it not being recognized by my computer. Started to get messages that there are too many bad sectors. If you buy it, do not save anything to it that you consider worth keeping; otherwise, you will likely be spending money on software to try and recover your information.
customer_reviews.author: K. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drives!
customer_reviews.text: I have 8 of these drives and use them for back-ups, storage for select files (music, videos, etc) and to keep in the bag with the laptop. Experience has taught me that when a hard drive goes bad, and they do, it's a real pain restoring the data, so I'm happier backing them up onto these drives. For the price, you can't beat them!
customer_reviews.author: Geezer G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in the USB port and its ready to go. Very impressed with this unit. Data transferred very quickly.. not a huge backup job but I had about 20GB of pics/vids and it took about 2 minutes total using 3.0 USB (ss). Not much else to say, very well worth the price. PS - the wire and leaflet are packaged under the interior carton. I was pissed off that it didnt come with a cable until I happened to look underneath. Kind of a strange place but nontheless wanted to mention this...
customer_reviews.author: MBooth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The day I received it, I plugged it in the usb port on my laptop, clicked on backup and restore and it immediately started backing up my files along with a system image of my system. 45 minutes later it was finished. Unplugged it to store it in a safe place until next time and I was done. If it was that easy for me, anybody can do it. Also I didn't install the trial software that came with it since I just want to use the windows backup and restore program on my system. Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: hughman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several months ago for my daughter to use as a back up for her pictures and videos which were hogging my HD space. We have had no problems with it. Seems sturdy, though we haven't abused it and it's been very convenient for storage. I've owned WD products in the past and always been happy with them...
customer_reviews.author: maxjam98

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Cake!
customer_reviews.text: Im giving it 5 stars b/c it was effortless as i expected! I plugged it into the USB port and there it was. I have an older HP and needed to move all my videos and pics ASAP and it had no problem finding this device and doing the job!! I dont know how it would hook up to a MAC. The drive feels heavy and built nice (not light and cheap) a case would be nice for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sps

customer_reviews.title: Most of the reviews were great, so it was upsetting to know it stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to back up everything on my computer. It stopped working after a few months which was disappointing since I had just bought it and it was more than I would have wanted to pay. Most of the reviews were great, so it was upsetting to know it stopped working after a short amount of time. I do not think I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: brownsugar21

customer_reviews.title: 6 Years Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive back in 2014 as a backup drive for my desktop. Since that day it's been backed up to constantly almost every single day and it still shows no signs of failing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dessert

customer_reviews.title: This WD external HD is compact and lightweight and perfect for my traveling needs
customer_reviews.text: I use both Mac and PC and after having a problem with a couple of different name brand external hard drives I now only buy Western Digital external hard drives. This WD external HD is compact and lightweight and perfect for my traveling needs. I've never had a problem accessing content on both my Mac and PC from this hard drive. I like to keep different content on different portable hard drives. This is the fourth portable HD I've purchased from Western Digital and I've always been very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Girl On The Move

customer_reviews.title: I'm never a fan of anyone's "backup software" but it was easily removed. Storage is quick and reliable thanks to ...
customer_reviews.text: Cable could be a bit longer, but all in all this works well. I'm never a fan of anyone's "backup software" but it was easily removed. Storage is quick and reliable thanks to the USB 3.0 interface. Cable is well made and looks like it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dissenter

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned too many of these external hard drives, so not sure what to look for in one. Works beautifully for me, quite enough, sturdy, and formats easily. Only grind I have with it is unless your using it on a desk all the time you might want to invest in a usb extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: B Penrod

customer_reviews.title: Extra storage, affordable, and portable!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for some extra storage space, what better way to get it than one of these. Have always had tremendous success with Western Digital. These things are very portable (about as big as a large smartphone) and easy to use. Cable length is a bit on the short side but I've never had problems.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Wii U
customer_reviews.text: I now have 100 games on Wii U. works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Poole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent external drive. Self contained -- no power module needed. Fast data transfers.
customer_reviews.author: em1533

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wii U
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Wii U with no problems so far. I was able to free up a lot of space on my Wii U . If you buy this for Wii U, keep in mind you need a y cable in order for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Once you are hacked with a bad virus, it allows quick restoration of all programs ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a back up drive for my computer. Once you are hacked with a bad virus, it allows quick restoration of all programs and files.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk J.

customer_reviews.title: but they have great reliability and you can save a few dollars buying ...
customer_reviews.text: This has relatively little storage capacity compared to the latest ones that offer up to 4X more, but they have great reliability and you can save a few dollars buying this now-discontinued size. And 500GB is still quite a bit and completely adequate for all but the largest photo or video libraries.
customer_reviews.author: vacuumtubejazzpro

customer_reviews.title: plug and play
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use this and was plenty of space for a backup for me. Some of these were really overkill. It ran nicely when I had to restore my files after a total restore I had to make with windows 7 and I am no expert so worked out just great.
customer_reviews.author: Asmolik

customer_reviews.title: Love this hard dirve!
customer_reviews.text: It took a minute or two to figure out how to put my videos on it but it was well worth it. I thought that as soon as you plug it in it will automatically download your hard drive. After figuring it out that I had to copy and paste my videos it was a breeze. Now I will always have my videos of the television shows that I love.
customer_reviews.author: tanquantwal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on just like this about 3 years ago. I have used it to store my pictures. I bought the second one to store all my business booking keeping. If some one is on my computer at home they can't access my business records.
customer_reviews.author: JL Feth

customer_reviews.title: Product exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Just backed up my work 2016 MacBook Pro (using a USB-C adapter.) Great value, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sifelaver

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my computer out, nothing is wrong with my computer. Once everything was deleted off my computer and I safely removed this I lost 50% of everything! It's worthless! I'd ended up going with Transended. Won't use WD in the future.
customer_reviews.author: K.J

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough for Price
customer_reviews.text: good solid product- I also have a WD Passport which is the higher quality version of this- I can honestly say its worth it to spend the extra $15 to get the passport- I had a lot more trouble setting the Elements up. Overall, its good enough.
customer_reviews.author: sarah cruz

customer_reviews.title: Always good to have extra hard drives for backup and storage
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have extra hard drives for backup and storage. This one is great - not my preference (bought for a friend), but still great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Crap!! HD crashed on me on little over a year, lost a ton of data. I know HD's crap out but this is to short a life span and will be purchasing other companies other then WD.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baur

customer_reviews.title: Let's just say that It's a great Product from a great company
customer_reviews.text: Let's just say that It's a great Product from a great company.....I take it pretty much where ever I go....and I go everywhere......I love taking pictures and all I have to do is hook this little gem into my laptop and store all of them on this drive until the next time I'm at home....easy as that....great product.............
customer_reviews.author: rontu hart

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: As advertised except it should have noted that only one USB port is required. This is as I wanted so am pleased. Fast shipment is also appreciated. Good seller, good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Daddybob

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works like New Years later. A must have especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Island Guy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Delivery of Video Files to Client
customer_reviews.text: Made for Windows use, but quickly upgraded to Mac after a solution search on Google.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: If I'd known how long it would work i wouldn't have bought it
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for about a month, now it isn't recognized when plugged in and gparted only returns read/write errors.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fast hard drive , 3.0 speed,  so easy to use and very quick on the download of my 138 GB of data.
customer_reviews.text: so easy to use and very quick on the download of my 138 GB of data. I'll definitely be getting another, sometime in the future. I have so many photos and music to download and I know these drives will protect them. Freddy
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked fine
customer_reviews.text: yeah no problems or anything. did what it's supposed to. was a good deal
customer_reviews.author: j.d.

customer_reviews.title: Failure to disconnect issues
customer_reviews.text: This unit has failure to eject/disconnect issues and has resulted in the loss of valuable project data. The company has promised to replace the unit but two days worth of work has been lost unless an IT pro can extract the data somehow (which will cost $). Not happy with this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Pawlak

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found out before it was a problem for ...
customer_reviews.text: This lasted exactly two years. I treated it well, and it simply stopped working. Glad I found out before it was a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Item as described. Fair pricing. Item failed within warranty period and was replaced with an upgraded item promptly and without any hassle what so ever. Will continue to purchase from WD.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kaliche

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect! I love that its a simple usb hard drive
customer_reviews.author: Jesi Castle

customer_reviews.title: Ok so far.
customer_reviews.text: Worked gor for a few hours then it started making a clicking noise and stopped working. Sent it back for a replacement so far so good. Will post back if anthing changes.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Using as hard drive for Nintendo Wii U, with a USB Y cable. Works perfectly, no issues, despite Nintendo's disclaimer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Small, no setup required, plenty of space.  Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, recognized immediately by backup software, also had enough space after backup to resave certain files in more easily accessible (i.e. non-monolithic) format. Was exactly what we needed, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: more then enough for me I use it on my ...
customer_reviews.text: more then enough for me I use it on my HP stream laptop. It very small and lightweight I am able to take any where
customer_reviews.author: Simply Being Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, slim profile, single cable, and tons of storage. I rarely ever need 1TB of stuff when I travel, so this is just right for the money. So far it's done its job and continues to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Law

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, I have had this for about a year now and have not experienced any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aletheia

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: After more than a year of heavy use, I can say for sure, is a great hard drive, not too big but for a couple of movies and music, works great
customer_reviews.author: Powertechreview

customer_reviews.title: Handy storage
customer_reviews.text: I needed to make 2 copies of data for customers. I bought 2 of these drives, they worked very well. I have used these WD portable hard drives in past, they always work, and I have never had any issues. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: gamma_ray

customer_reviews.title: Easily back up everything on this drive
customer_reviews.text: Easily back up everything on this drive. I realized later that I should have bough a Solid State but that was more expensive
customer_reviews.author: htanv

customer_reviews.title: Works on Raspberry Pi without a Hub
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive to use in a jukebox run from a Raspberry Pi. It is well documented that the USB ports on the Raspberry Pi are not high powered, so in order to expand your storage, a powered USB hub is often necessary. Not with this Western Digital Elements 500 GB drive. I was able to run this off my Raspberry Pi without any problems. Its been on 24/7 for about 4 months now with no problems. The drive is small, quiet, and plenty roomy for a jukebox filled with MP3 files.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. EckmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for time machine I use this too backup my files on my computer it's small and portable so you can take it with you if you need too go somewhere. I recommend the 1TB version though as I couldn't afford at the time it.
customer_reviews.author: Mwpuga

customer_reviews.title: Used as Time Machine back-up for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Use this as a Time Machine back-up for one of my Mac Mini computers. Worked well right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: EeeVee

customer_reviews.title: WD 500 GB WD Elements Portable USB 3.0 HD Storage
customer_reviews.text: Came real fast and very easy to use! It is small and can fit in my purse with no trouble. I'm basically using it for my photos. Need to make room on my Hard Drive in laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Diane E Wood

customer_reviews.title: good backup drive
customer_reviews.text: works well without any isssues. Drive hasn't failed or any software glitches. Good backup drive for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mello

customer_reviews.title: HD review!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small packaged, large external hard drive. It holds data and does it well. Buy one if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Webhead

customer_reviews.title: I use these all the time! Portable and inexpensive ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time! Portable and inexpensive. I use them only to transport and back up files. Should not be used as a single main hard drive for anything of importance.
customer_reviews.author: Bodybuilding Flix

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Wii U storage, works great! Requires Y Adapter cable to do this though.
customer_reviews.text: I ran out of space on my wii u and i needed an external hard drive so I bought this thing. You CANNOT hook this up to a wii u alone and expect it to work. You need the Y Adapter cable, which will allow it to connect to the two front usb ports under the cover. This is so that i can draw enough power. If you do not want to buy a Y Adapter and are in need of a hard drive for a wii u, buy a hard drive that uses an AC cord. Otherwise, this is awesome. Also works great with a computer. Computers don't have this issue, it's a wii u thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus B.

customer_reviews.title: ... gift for my sister and it seems it worked pretty well. Nice quality and and size
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my sister and it seems it worked pretty well. Nice quality and and size, it is light weight and thin enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dany

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say - it has more than enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say - it has more than enough space for all 4 of my machines' stuff. No problems with it so far.

customer_reviews.title: Great add on
customer_reviews.text: A great add on storage unit for laptops in a docking station

customer_reviews.text: A cya in case your computer breaks down. Easy to install and set up times for backups.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: probably already obsolete, but nice compact size and good storage capacity for the cost.

customer_reviews.text: connects to your computer and the software helps manage format the drive I really enjoy it

customer_reviews.title: For college student
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my sister who is in college. Seems useful since she'll be keeping tons of documents, files, pictures, etc. She had trouble setting it up, but Googled it and it worked out.
